main event: An oval-shaped object, described as a bluish-green fireball, was observed traveling at high speed over Philadelphia, Pennsylvania on January 29, 1952.
interesting points: The object was reported to have a visibility duration of approximately 10-12 seconds., The fireball was observed at a distance of 50 to 100 miles from the observer., Dr. Charles F. Olivier received around 150 reports about the incident from the public., The brilliance of the fireball was comparable to that of a quarter-moon., Dr. Olivier stated that the phenomenon occurred as described but did not personally observe it.
